intro: Hesperis matronalis proles nivea, commonly known as the white sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which bloom in early summer, range in color from white to pale purple, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
